.W: The effect of cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) on the disposition of vancomycin (15 mg/kg) and of netilmicin (3 mg/kg) was studied in 10 adults. Vancomycin and netilmicin exhibited initial decreases in mean concentrations in serum of 4.0 mg/liter (16.8%) and 2.2 mg/liter (29.1%), respectively, upon initiation of CPB. Netilmicin concentrations in serum rebounded to a mean of 0.6 mg/liter (15.4%) within 90 min on CPB and then continuously decreased. The rebound in vancomycin concentration in serum strongly correlated with the length of time between unclamping the aorta and coming off CPB (r = 0.94), as well as with the increase in temperature upon rewarming (r = 0.92).

.W: Improvements and new applications for the technique of immunoassay have been extensive, owing in part to improvements in specific binding reagents used.
